intro: Reaumuria persica, commonly known as Persian sandthrift, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia and the Middle East. It is a low-growing shrub with woody stems and small, scale-like leaves adapted to conserve water. The plant produces yellow or reddish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to thrive in sandy and saline soils. Reaumuria persica is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and withstand harsh environmental conditions.
